unnormalised: **National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) Announces Revised Toll Rates Effective 01/04/2024**
normalised: national highway authority of india (N-H-A-I) announces revised toll rates effective first april two thousand and twenty four

unnormalised: New Delhi – The National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) has announced a revision in toll rates across national highways, effective from April 1, 2024. The adjustment, typically implemented annually, reflects the Wholesale Price Index (WPI) and aims to offset the rising costs associated with highway maintenance and operation. The average increase is projected to be in the range of 3% to 5%, although specific rates will vary depending on the highway stretch and vehicle type.
normalised: new delhi – the national highway authority of india (N-H-A-I) has announced a revision in toll rates across national highways, effective from april first, two thousand and twenty four. the adjustment, typically implemented annually, reflects the wholesale price index (W-P-I) and aims to offset the rising costs associated with highway maintenance and operation. the average increase is projected to be in the range of three percent to five percent, although specific rates will vary depending on the highway stretch and vehicle type.

unnormalised: According to an official statement released by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, the revised rates will apply to all toll plazas operational on national highways, including the Delhi-Meerut Expressway and the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. The ministry assures the public that the collected revenue will be reinvested into infrastructure development, including road widening, safety enhancements, and the construction of new underpasses and flyovers to ease traffic congestion.

unnormalised: The toll rate for a car on the Delhi-Jaipur highway is expected to rise from Rs. 285 to approximately Rs. 300 for a single journey. Similarly, truck drivers using the Bengaluru-Chennai highway might see an increase from Rs. 450 to Rs. 475 per trip. Commuters utilizing the newly constructed Nagpur-Mumbai Samruddhi Mahamarg will also experience a hike in toll charges.

unnormalised: The NHAI has also clarified that frequent commuters and those residing within a 20 km radius of toll plazas are eligible for discounted rates. Individuals can avail of monthly passes or local resident concessions by submitting the necessary documentation at the respective toll booths. The authority encourages users to opt for FASTag electronic toll collection to ensure seamless and contactless transactions, thereby reducing waiting times at toll plazas.

unnormalised: While the toll rate revision is a standard practice, it often draws mixed reactions from the public. Transport associations have expressed concerns about the potential impact on transportation costs and commodity prices. Mr. Rajesh Gupta, President of the All India Motor Transport Congress (AIMTC), stated that the hike would burden truck operators, especially during the current economic climate. He urged the government to consider alternative revenue generation models.

unnormalised: However, NHAI officials emphasize that well-maintained highways contribute significantly to fuel efficiency, reduced travel time, and enhanced safety. They argue that the toll charges are essential for sustaining the quality of road infrastructure and ensuring its long-term viability. The authority also pointed out that India’s toll rates are still relatively competitive compared to those in developed countries.

unnormalised: The ministry has established a grievance redressal mechanism to address any concerns or complaints related to the toll rate revision. Citizens can lodge their grievances through the NHAI website or by calling the toll-free helpline number 1033. The NHAI assures prompt resolution of all complaints and emphasizes its commitment to transparency and accountability. The new rates are expected to generate an additional Rs. 1500 crore in revenue for the NHAI annually, which will be crucial for funding various infrastructure projects across the country.
